dry dock.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a place where a ship can be taken out of the water for repairs
dry dock.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an enclosed place used for repairing or building ships, from which the water can be pumped in and out
dry dock.translation[1].definitions[0].e: We were towed to a dry dock in New York.
The ship is in dry dock for an overhaul.
